data.title: Develop3d
data.body:
Altered 2MGFX/Program.cs to make program and entry point public.
Altered 2MGFX/Program.cs to write errors via Console.Error.WriteLine() instead of Console.WriteLine()

This commit adds a Visual Studio custom tool wrapper for the 2MGFX effect compiler.

data.title: Rotating Android Device Ignores ScreenOrientation and SupportedOrientations
data.body:
ScreenOrientation is supplied as Landscape on the Activity and SupportedOrientations is set to LandscapeLeft and LandscapeRight within the Initialize block of the Game itself, however when you rotate the device, the Activity still restarts and the Game is then displayed in Portrait, etc.

Adding the ConfigurationChanges = ConfigChanges.Orientation | ConfigChanges.Keyboard | ConfigChanges.KeyboardHidden doesn't seem to impact anything (OnConfigurationChanged wasn't called).

This is on 2.5 release.

data.title: Develop3d - AndroidGameWindow to use common frame timing in Game.Tick()
data.body:
Followed the example of OpenTKGameWindow and simply called Game.Tick() from OnUpdateFrame(). The GraphicsContext validation in OnRenderFrame() is still there as it is in OpenTKGameWindow, but I'm not certain if it's required or if here is the best place for it.

I've tested loading content on a different thread and it still works.

data.title: Develop3d - PSS Fixes: Song & Double Render Bug
data.body:
2 Commits for PSS today.

1) Gets Song to work. You can only have one BgmPlayer around at a time (creating a second = crash), so we ensure that is the case by having a static one and ensuring it is null before making a new one.

2) Stops PSSGamePlatform calling Render itself, Game.Tick() Calls it internally, so calling it again makes us call Game.Draw(...) twice, making rendering happen twice as often as it should. This bug is also on Android as mentioned here: https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/494#issuecomment-6091936

data.title: Develop3d - Get Android building, Fix for TouchPanel release events
data.body:
AndroidGameWindow was not compiling due to changes in GameTime (Tom removed the Update method to be XNA4 api compliant). I switched to using a GameTime constructor instead of calling Update.

Touch released events were being lost due to a removal list never being cleared. This was probably never picked up as some platforms cycle their touch ID values. Android (or at least the emulator) always uses 0 for the touch ID causing only the first release event to be populated in TouchPanel.GetState().

data.title: Develop3d
data.body: MonoTouch doesn't implement the Restart() function on System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch, so I've modified Game to call Reset() and Start() instead - this has the same result.

data.title: Develop3d
data.body: Reverted prior changes to 2MGFX project file to maintain reference path integrity to Thirdparty/Libs submodule. Removed VS2010 SDK dependencies.

data.title: Added functionality to load SpriteFonts from bitmap fonts stored in PNG ...
data.body:
...files.

Added functionality to the SpriteFontReader to be able to parse a PNG file that has a rendered bitmap font into a SpriteFont. This allows developers to use third-party utilities to convert a TTF font into a bitmap font file and load it through the Content manager. Currently, I just added PNG support as GetPixel/GetData throws an exception when using a BMP file. 

Ultimately, it is just a cheap method of getting fonts into a game. The parsing algorithm is very basic. Please email any questions that you have.

data.title: SpriteBatch.End (): invalid enum exception when calling GL.TexEnv()
data.body:
Hi there,

I'm completely new to OpenSource dev, so forgive if I'm doing things the wrong way.

Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch.End ( )
Line 185: 
GL.TexEnv(TextureEnvTarget.TextureEnv, TextureEnvParameter.TextureEnvMode, (int)All.BlendSrc);

This line is giving me an exception with the message "Invalid Enum". I looked up here http://www.opengl.org/sdk/docs/man/xhtml/glTexEnv.xml and it seems BlendSrc is not allowed as an enum value, when I did replace it with Blend it worked. 

I'm not really sure what the intention was and if Blend is the correct value.

Anyway, it would be great if one of you experts could check this. I can fix it the way I described it, just let me know.

Best regards,
svf3

data.title: WinRT RC1 Fixes
data.body:
Fixing build for latest WinRT preview. 

Now remaping generic versions of some modifier keys which XNA does not have in its Keys enum to the 'Left' version of that key.

data.title: Develop3d
data.body:
Added Visual Studio 2010 custom tool for building MGFX effects within the IDE. 
I had to make a small change to 2MGFX/Program.cs to make the Program class and Main() method public, and to direct error messages to Console.Error (which is only relevant to calling processes and shouldn't make a difference when running 2MGFX.exe from the command line.)

I also made a change to 2MGFX.csproj to fix some bad references on _my_ machine, but I can't see how to exclude that file from the pull request.

data.title: MGFX Parser, WinRT Improvements, and MGEffectProcessor
data.body:
This pull includes a refactored 2MGFX which includes its own MGFX textual file format parser made with TinyPG…

http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/28294/a-Tiny-Parser-Generator-v1-2

This means we no longer have a dependency on the legacy Microsoft FX format and Effect code and can enhance the MGFX format to meet our own needs. My next step there is to support GLSL within MGFX files input to 2MGFX.

Also this pull includes a new MGEffectProcessor for processing custom Effect objects in the content pipeline for all MonoGame platforms.

data.title: Android Orientation Problem
Win8 Fixes
data.body:
I rebuilt all DX11 shaders to compile with the "level_9_3" compatibility mode which should allow them to run on a non-DX10 card and/or a VM.

I also fixed the mouse wheel to work under Win8.

data.title: develop3d- Fix for work item 6883
data.body: double.Parse() needs to be forced to work with the invariant culture when converting the system version to a number to avoid issues with cultures that use other decimal separators.

data.title: VertexBufferBinding is missing and usage of VertexOffset.
data.body: There is no VertexBufferBinding support into GraphicsDevice and think of using VertexBufferBinding.VertexOffset when performing GL.VertexAttribPointer.

data.title: GamepadConfig is not Open Source
data.body:
MonoGame builds against a closed-source library for gamepad support. This means that for distribution in Free Software distributions like Debian Linux, either MonoGame needs to go into the non-free repository (which carries all sorts of messy baggage), or have all support for gamepads ripped out in the package version of the library.

GamepadConfig should be replaced by something under a Free license.

data.title: Gestures, Tick, and SpriteFont
data.body:
This pull has a few different things in it...
## Common Touch/Gesture Code

The gesture recognition code from iOS has been moved to TouchPanel and enhanced to support screens with different DPIs.  Touch event logic is all moved to TouchPanel as well with each platform just needing to forward raw press/move/release events to TouchPanel.AddEvent().

iOS and WinRT both use the gesture code... someone needs to remove the Android OS gestures for these.
## Tick Refactor

The Game.Tick() code has been refactored to work correctly for fixed updates, support draw suppression, and use the more accurate Stopwatch for timing.  It is also simpler to read and understand.  GameTime has been fixed to be correct to XNA4 api.
## SpriteFont Optimization

The use of ThreadStatic and the unnecessary abstractions in SpriteFont have been removed reducing the CPU overhead and moving a bunch of unnecessary calculations.  It shaved at least a 40% performance improvement from one benchmark.  See http://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions/355590.

data.title: Add two Matrix.CreateReflection functions and allow ReflectiveReader to skip write only properties
develop3d - Matrix.CreateReflection does not exist?
data.body: There's no stub or working method for Matrix.CreateReflection, available in XNA 4.

data.title: develop3d- Fixed incorrect backface culling
data.body:
- GraphicsDevice.Initialize was not being called.
- Force calls to GLStateManager in GraphicsDevice.Initialize to set initial render states.

data.title: Added MediaQueue to develop branch
data.body: This needs testing on ios/Mac and Linux but it should be ok.

data.title: have the iOS project use the Desktop OpenAL audio files
data.body:
- these file were removed from the MacOS folder as they were identical
  to the desktop versions

data.title: Added full alphabet to keyboard class in Android/Input/Keyboard.cs
data.body: Signed-off-by: tophathacker tophathacker@gmail.com

data.title: Keyboard map
data.body: I updated the keyboard mappings to include numbers and letters. I'll include all the rest of the keys when I have time.

data.title: MGSoundEffectProcessor Improvements
data.body:
- The processor now adjusts the bitrate of it's input according to how XNA for Zune worked since it cannot compress them.
- We properly convert .wma and .mp3 files to uncompressed PCM sounds.

Note we started to test mp3 compressed sound effects on iOS.  This would give us a small file so package and load from disk, but we would quickly decompress them at load time to a PCM for playback via OpenAL.

Unfortunately it seems MonoTouch/iOS cannot decompress an MP3 and return the raw PCM data to us.  We would have to include a 3rd-party library to do that which isn't something we want to do at the moment.

The good news is this work will eventually help on Android where from what we understand can use mp3 sound effects natively.

data.title: Update ClientBounds and PresentationParameters.Bounds on window resize (Desktop)
data.body: This patch updates the major window bound parameters (ClientBounds, Viewport, PresentationParameters) on window resizing. Previously, only Viewport was updated after a window resize. This also indirectly resolves the renderTarget issue in #446 without the need to cache viewport size.

data.title: develop3d compile-time errors from Song.cs in Linux
data.body:
I encountered the following compile-time errors when trying to build the develop3d branch on Linux:
- The FinishedPlayingHander delegate (Line 64) is internal, but the SetEventHandler method (Line 91) expects a public argument. Declaring FinishedPlayingHander as public resolves this, but neither object is in the XNA public API of Song (or at least not in the documentation), so this is probably not the preferred solution.
- _sound.FinishedPlaying (Line 116) is not defined anywhere. It is probably an out-of-date SoundEffectInstance in Desktop.

There are some other Linux-specific issues, but they are probably better discussed in #466.
